alfredsnippet.snippet:
(cont'd)

"One of the most far-reaching consequences of MRI was that it could be used to distinguish tumor cells from non-tumor cells.  The distinction rested on an apparent difference of cell water, for differences of water-protons' relaxation times underlie the MRI image.  Water appeared less structured in tumor cells, and this result was amply documented (e.g., Damadian, 1971; Beall et al., 1982).  It now appears that much of the difference may arise from differences of paramagnetic ion content between cancer and non-cancer cells ..."
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - The MRI and the Nobel Prize - Part 3
